meanings.definition: A person who drinks greedily or excessively.
meanings.sent1: The swillers at the party finished all the soda in no time.
meanings.sent2: The swillers at the bar ordered round after round of drinks.
meanings.sent3: The swillers at the picnic gulped down their lemonade like it was a race.
meanings.sent4: The swillers in the movie theater slurped their sodas loudly during the quiet scenes.
meanings.sent5: The swillers at the buffet filled their cups with soda to the brim, spilling some on the table.
meanings.sent6: After the game, the swillers chugged their water bottles to quench their thirst.
meanings.sent7: The swillers in the cafeteria always finished their milk cartons before anyone else.
meanings.sent8: During the hot summer day, the swillers drank all the lemonade at the stand.
meanings.sent9: The swillers at the party quickly emptied the punch bowl, asking for refills.
meanings.sent10: At the family reunion, the swillers drank all the iced tea before the ice melted.

meanings.sent1: The thirsty dog swillers water from its bowl after a long walk.
meanings.sent2: After the race, the runners swillers their energy drinks to recover quickly.
meanings.sent3: The kids swillers their juice boxes before heading out to play.
meanings.sent4: She swillers her coffee every morning to wake up for work.
meanings.sent5: The workers swillers their water bottles to stay hydrated during the shift.
